context:
| 30 June 2019 | 30 June 2018
--- | --- | ---
 | $'000 | $'000
Right-of-use assets* |  | 
Properties | 68,569 | 5,070
Motor Vehicles | 259 | -
Connectivity Links | 9,696 | -
 | 78,524 | 5,070

paragraph 1: 12 Leases
paragraph 2: (a) Leases
paragraph 3: (i) Amounts recognised in the Consolidated Balance Sheet
paragraph 4: The Consolidated Balance Sheet includes the following amounts relating to leases:
paragraph 5: Additions to the right-of-use assets during the 2019 financial year were $0.3 million.
paragraph 6: (ii) Amounts recognised in the Consolidated Statement of Comprehensive Income
paragraph 7: The Consolidated Statement of Comprehensive Income shows the following amounts relating to leases:
paragraph 8: The total cash outflow for leases in 2019 was $8.6 million.
paragraph 9: (iii) The group’s leasing activities and how these are accounted for
paragraph 10: The Group has a number of leases over property, motor vehicles, and connectivity links that have varying terms, escalation clauses and renewal rights.
paragraph 11: Leases are recognised as a right-of-use asset and a corresponding liability at the date at which the leased asset is available for use by the Group. Each lease payment is allocated between the liability and finance cost. The finance cost is charged to profit or loss over the lease term so as to produce a constant periodic rate of interest on the remaining balance of the liability for each year. The right-of-use asset is depreciated over the shorter of the asset's useful life and the lease term on a straight-line basis.
paragraph 12: Assets and liabilities arising from a lease are initially measured on a present value basis. Lease liabilities include the net present value of the following lease payments:
paragraph 13: - fixed payments (including in-substance fixed payments), less any lease incentives receivable  fixed payments (including in-substance fixed payments), less any lease incentives receivable
paragraph 14: - variable lease payments that are based on an index or a rate
paragraph 15: - amounts expected to be payable by the lessee under residual value guarantees
paragraph 16: - the exercise price of a purchase option if the lessee is reasonably certain to exercise that option, and
paragraph 17: - payments of penalties for terminating the lease, if the lease term reflects the lessee exercising that option.
paragraph 18: The lease payments are discounted using the interest rate implicit in the lease, if that rate can be determined, or the Group’s incremental borrowing rate.
paragraph 19: Right-of-use assets are measured at cost comprising the following:
paragraph 20: - the amount of the initial measurement of lease liability
paragraph 21: - any lease payments made at or before the commencement date, less any lease incentives received
paragraph 22: - any initial direct costs, and
paragraph 23: - restoration costs.
paragraph 24: Payments associated with short-term leases and leases of low-value assets are recognised on a straight-line basis as an expense in profit or loss. Short-term leases are leases with a lease term of 12 months or less. Low-value assets comprise IT-equipment and small items of office furniture.
paragraph 25: (iv) Extension and termination options
paragraph 26: Extension and termination options are included in a number of property and equipment leases across the Group. These terms are used to maximise operational flexibility in terms of managing contracts. The majority of extension and termination options held are exercisable only by the Group and not by the respective lessor.

qa.question: What costs are taken into account for measuring Right-of-use assets?
qa.answer: ['the amount of the initial measurement of lease liability', 'any lease payments made at or before the commencement date, less any lease incentives received', 'any initial direct costs', 'restoration costs']
